p: Achyranthes bidentata, ( Figure 4D) belonging to Amaranthaceae, is a well-known medicinal plant very common near the villages and used by local people to treat various diseases such as fever (FL about 33%) and maternal ailments (FL about 44%). Accordingly, this species showed the highest relative frequency of citation. These findings are a novelty, because a previous study on the same area reported only the use of this species for the treatment of urinary ailments [ 16].
